intro: Galium vassilczenkoi, commonly known as the Armenian bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky slopes. Galium vassilczenkoi is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
